column6: I LOVED this conditioner, until the scalp issues started.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2021
column14: I used this conditioner for well over a year, along with the matching shampoo, and everything was dandy. My hair looked and felt great. Then, about December of 2020, I noticed my scalp had become increasingly itchy. I figured it was just dry, but then, I noticed my hair was beginning to shed more as well. After doing some research, I figured out why. This product contains DMDM Hydantoin, which causes scalp issues and hair loss in some people, and apparently I'm one of those *lucky* people. For those who may not have heard of this ingredient, another hair care company is currently being sued for the same issues with the ingredient in their products.

I'm not a fan of overly floral hair products and the coconut is refreshing but not overpowering. I use this on my toddler's hair too and it's always so soft and shiny. I love the nice big bottle! I don't use a whole lot at a time and this lasts me forever!

column6: Nexxus Therappe and Humectress hair loss
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2021
column14: I am writing to inform and compare with any others who have also experienced the same hair loss issues both my 19 year old son and I, his mother have expereinced since using these products.  My son has been getting patches of hair loss/baldness as well as major thinning to the point he looks like a 60 year old man balding.  I also have been worrying about why everytime a take a shower i lose a significant amount of hair, way more then a normal shedding.  An artical and post re hair loss due to tresumme and a preservative DMDM Hydantoin caught my attention.  AS i read further, i noticed nexxus was listed on the list of produts using this ingredient, then confirmed it's in both of these products.  I was thinking it was our water, not sure what but we've had bloodwork done, going to dermatologists and then today i see this post and discover nexxus isn't even nexxus anymore, it was acquired by unilever, same company as Tresumme.  This seems to have some serious credibility and I am so upset these companies can do this to people.  Why does the government allow these companies to hide things and still sell the products.

column6: it's not very severe but it is constant and annoying (and I believe hormone related)

I read online that using dandruff shampoo with "Ketaconazole" as the active ingredient as a face wash was really effective at getting rid of acne. I was skeptical, as I said I've tried everything from prescription creams, benzoyl peroxide, special face washes, natural products and oils and nothing seemed to work. This stuff surprisingly has cleared my face. I wash my face with this stuff in the morning and at night and let it sit for 1-2 minutes before washing off. Also, I moisturize with Vaseline on my face overnight (another acne relief miracle worker I read online--no it doesn't clog your pores). If you have acne I would suggest looking up this product and Vaseline uses as well, worked for me. Hopefully my routine continues to work. If it doesn't I will update!

column6: Caused a painful, irritated scalp. Not good.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
column14: I used this for 2 weeks. 5 times all together and the last time I used it I started to notice my scalp was hurting, like from clogged or irritated pores or something. I have experienced this type of reaction with some shampoos in the past. I never knew what caused it. I love my Andalou citrus shampoo that I have been using this past year, with the conditioner but I was just wanting a bit more volume at my roots. I still have not found a leave in to give my roots volume, so I thought shampoo might do the trick. There were a ton of positive reviews and this is a fair price. So, I figured why not try it? My scalp hurts so bad now!!! I have KP (Keratosis pilaris) which is a skin condition that is basically small, red bumps of clogged hair follicles. There is no treatment and it is not contagious, it‚Äôs just genetics. So maybe an ingredient that this contains caused a flare up. Possibly the peppermint? It is a known skin irritator. It also made my hair dry and frizzy. REALLY frizzy. It didn‚Äôt make my scalp greasy, though and that‚Äôs why I kept using it. It didn‚Äôt really add any volume and combating the frizz I eas was tough. I also started to notice my hair was thinning a bit, so I discontinued use and went back to my original shampoo. My hair is starting to recover but my scalp is still in bad condition. Its still painful and irritated. Hurts to touch. It‚Äôs only been around 4 days since I stopped using it, though. This also contains sodium hydroxide and that could have have caused a problem, too. Honestly, I would not recommend this. I would recommend the Andalou citrus shampoo and the Christina Moss shampoo for salon quality hair. I am going to try the Andalou volumizing shampoo next since I seem to have better luck with their brand! 2 stars for the fair price and almost all good ingredients.

Post-pregnancy, my hair started thinning, lost it luster and turned extremely fine, wavy, and frizzy so I started using natural products. After turning to SLS free products, I was happy that I was giving my hair much needed TLC but none of the products made me fall in love with them because I couldn't see visible results (shiny, frizz-free, bouncy hair etc. as they usually promise) UNTIL I tried this one!  This curl shampoo enhances, like a curl cream or other styling product, and makes my wavy hair curly almost immediately- I wonder if it's the neem oil or hibiscus but the effect is darn visible! I love it because the look I get right after I shampoo and air dry my hair is natural, healthy, curly, and more tamed than other SLS products have gotten me. On a side note, my mom has been using Shea Moisture hair color and she swears by it too! Shea moisture seems like a reputed and effective brand because it's delivering results. Can't wait to try out their other products too..

column6: The Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner are amazing products
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018
column14: I decided to order the Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner for severely damaged hair cause I was having a lot of hair breakage and shedding and I absolutely resented hair wash days. My hair was brittle and seemed always dry no matter what products I would put on it. I thought that I would have had to cut my hair and start completely over. However, when my products arrived, I could not wait to give them a try. I love the smells. Very nice and not powerful. I washed my hair twice with the Nexxus Shampoo, first time just the scalp, and the second wash, the hair itself. The way that my hair reacted to this shampoo was breathtaking! My curls appeared and believe it or not, I was able to pull a comb through my thick, natural, 4C  hair!! I have never, ever been able to do this before while washing. Barely any hair was coming out in my comb! I had not even used the conditioner yet. I just had to stop and look in the mirror and talk to myself saying, "Omg, I cannot believe this"! I have never, ever experienced a shampoo doing my hair like this before. After I completely rinsed the shampoo from my hair, I moved on to the Nexxus Conditioner. Even more amazing. It stated to leave on the hair for 3 min, but I sat under a hooded dryer for about 10min with the conditioner on my hair, under a plastic cap. Once my time was up, I rinsed away all of the conditioner. My hair was so manageable!! I was able to comb and section it to do my bantu knots and allow my hair to dry overnight. After washing my hair, it only took me about 30 min to get it  all done to dry. I have never been able to complete this process this quickly before! I am highly satisfied with these products! Even though they are  expensive products, I'm hooked and will be purchasing again. I told my mom about my experience and am ready to try it on her hair also, to see if she gets the same experience and satisfaction that I got. Thank you Nexxus for such wonderful products, and thank you Amazon for carrying them. Definitely a must try on the Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner for Severely damaged hair. This is my first time ever writing a review on a product. That's how pleased I was with these products!!

column6: Great product for me...till they raised the price to a rediculous level!

I have a friend in England who can get it a lot cheaper, but the cost is still well above $15. Like many others who like and used this product, I'm done, will look for other alternatives.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2010
column14: Let me start this off with the fact that I have been trying to get control of my minor dandruff for almost 20 years. Tiny amounts on my shoulder or the back of my neck, on my pillow when I woke up in the morning, it was something I was very selfconscious about and embarrassed.  Being a guy though, I rarely go to the doctor, and really how many guys would go to the doctor to talk about such a small problem.  So I tried everything, every shampoo in the supermarket isle, I changed hair gels 20 times, stopped using hair gels all together.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2012
column14: I've had dandruff for years, and the only solution to keep it under control is ketoconazole, the active ingredient in Nizoral shampoo. After a 4-6 week treatment, the dandruff goes away for several months, up to one year, when it comes back and I need another 4-6 week treatment.

I use this 3 times a week and so far so good. I notice some flakes here and there but nothing like before. The smell is decent and there is no burning, I usually out it on then let it sit for a few minutes while I shave in the shower. Not sure if you have to let it sit but works for me. column6: Not a cure, but the best so far
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2013
column14: I've been using Nizoral 1% for about 8 months.  I've had very bad dandruff for over four years, as a result of dry skin than came on suddenly.  I find that almost any shampoo (even non-dandruff shampoos) will prevent dandruff for a few days.  Then it comes back as bad as ever.  Nizoral is the most effective shampoo I've tried.  It isn't a cure for me, as it has seemingly been for others here.  It started out great, nearly eliminating the flaking and itching.  After a couple of weeks of use about every 3 days, it became less effective, with flaking and itching starting in the afternoon -- but the flakes were smaller and the itching less intense than with other shampoos.  After eight months, it is still good, but I get flakes and itching every day.  It's expensive, but it offers some relief.  On the non-Nizoral days I usually use the Ginger shampoo from The Body Shop.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2021
column14: I am writing to inform and compare with any others who have also experienced the same hair loss issues both my 19 year old son and I, his mother have expereinced since using these products. I also have been worrying about why everytime a take a shower i lose a significant amount of hair, way more then a normal shedding.  An artical and post re hair loss due to tresumme and a preservative DMDM Hydantoin caught my attention.  AS i read further, i noticed nexxus was listed on the list of produts using this ingredient, then confirmed it's in both of these products.  I was thinking it was our water, not sure what but we've had bloodwork done, going to dermatologists and then today i see this post and discover nexxus isn't even nexxus anymore, it was acquired by unilever, same company as Tresumme. column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2020
column14: Best shampoo and conditioner I have used in years! I got pregnant a little over a year ago, and since then my hair has never been the same. I finally got it the color I wanted, but I've noticed my already thinning hair was falling out more and more. I've tried too many moisture renewal, damage repair, thickening, anti hair loss products to count over thse last year with absolutely no results. So finding this product and reading reviews I was excited to try this to slow down my hair loss and give me some volume. Last night was my first use and I am beyond impressed. Not only did my hair feel a tad bit fuller in just one wash, but it is extremely soft and moisturized for the first time in over a year! I was not expecting it to make my hair feel so amazing, in fact I was prepared for brittle tangly hair like most thickening shampoos and conditioners give me. The only thing I was a little disappointed with was the shampoo doesnt get super sudsy while washing, but that's a personal preference of mine. And I may have not used enough, so I'm going to try using a little more tonight! Since I have only used it once I will update this review in a few weeks. But even if it doesnt help with my hair loss, I plan to continue using this shampoo and conditioner just because it makes my hair feel amazing and HEALTHY!!!

I do not recommend this Amazon Redken Shampoo, as my hair was frizzy and dry, and my scalp was itchy after using it, not at all like the REAL Redken Shampoo supplied by my cosmotologist.

column6: Removed product buildup from my hair in one use!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2021
column14: I have very fine, straight hair that has the tendency to hold on to product. The only potential drawback for some people might be that it doesn't have a strong pleasant scent that I have noticed with other Nexxus products. Rather, it has a very light scent that reminds me of incense. I use a conditioner from Nexxus that smells of coconuts after using this product, but that's just personal preference. I would absolutely recommend this product if you want softer hair that won't retain product buildup!

column6: Dry hair ppl purchase a hair mask to add with this product!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021
column14: I gave 2 stars for softness because it dried out my hair (African type grade). Now for those who hair is naturally dry, do not run from this product. Purchase a good conditioning hair mask and apply before the matching contioner or after which ever you perfer. I do before to hydrate easier. When your out add some hydrating leave in creams. One of my favorite is butter cream by "As I Am". For Ethnic hair types I would not use this product everyday, due to the drying effect it gives. I would love to see the makes create a product that moisturizes as well for ethnic hair or even create a hair mask for dry hair. Even for Caucasian hair I would use a light pea size oil on palm when done, rub vigorously on palm and add to whole hair to keep the fly aways from looking like a over permed 80's curls. Overall I gave a 4 stars due to the overdrying effect it gives (that is to any hair type) but for Caucasian the conditioner should give a 5 syar effect. Would I purchase again? So far yes. I always do a re-review after a couple months. I feel this product is good for a youtube channel review, so I may do it there as well. Review would be if this product actually works? column14: I‚Äôve had thinning hair for over five years. I used to use Nizoral shampoo that my dermatologist recommended, as I also have scalp oiliness and dandruff associated with my hair loss. So I really wanted to find something that thoroughly cleaned all the scalp debris, didn‚Äôt bother my sensitive scalp, and could be used everyday. I‚Äôve been using the Nioxin system at the recommendation of a hair stylist for almost a year now, and I don‚Äôt plan on ever using anything else. It has kept my scalp in really great condition and is gentle enough to use daily. I can‚Äôt say it helps with hair loss necessarily, but I have seen more baby hairs growing recently so maybe it does a little. Mainly it will help with the overall appearance of your hair loss. It makes hair look super clean and thus thicker when you‚Äôre using it. Sometimes it can be hard to make thinner hair look clean as it always wants to look stringy. So it‚Äôs definitely helped with that. I would recommend giving it a shot if you have dandruff or hair loss issues.

I haven‚Äôt regrown all the hair that I lost, however, I can say that at a minimum, my hair loss stopped which I am happy with. Don‚Äôt expect this shampoo alone to work magic

column6: Class Action Law Suit filed 6/7/2021 (District Court of Northern IL District)

Now for the part that most people are interested in I have brunette and fine not thin/ thinning hair and both regular and extra strength versions even without the conditioner leave your hair extra silky smooth more manageable for my hair texture and fine hair type and bring out my natural colors and tones that are sometimes opaqued by cheap or heavily moisturizing shampoos. I still reccomend to add the extra strength argan oil conditioner it'll do even more wonders for you and leave an even more beautiful luster that brings out/ highlights your natural highlights. üòâ

column6: Used to be amazing, now only average.

column14: Well, a month ago, I'd have given this five stars, but the latest bottle I received is...essentially a completely different product. It has a completely different fragrance, nothing like before, and weak. That said, my hair seems to come out of the experience roughly the same. So I'll continue to use up this bottle. But after that, I'm not so sure. Frustrating to effectively been sold a completely different product from what I originally bought, without any 'warning' (like "New Fragrance! New texture!" on the bottle).

column14: I have always wanted to try this brand but the price kept me away. Finally I decided to take the plunge. I also bought the corresponding conditioner. A perfume smell but it's not overwhelming or strong. I followed with the conditioner. When I dried my hair I was in awe. I have straight, flat, thin hair. This shampoo, in just the first time I used it, did wonders for my hair. It was shiny, had life to it, was soft. But even though it was soft, I was able to curl it with a curling iron and it stayed. The scent stayed with me most of the day. I think the scent smells expensive too!!!! I think the bottle will last quite awhile since you only have to use a small amount. I do have short hair. I  know this is a lot of money to spend on shampoo, but the way my hair has changed for the better, it was easy to fix, saved me time and smells so good, to me it's worth it. I will definitely buy this shampoo again. No question about it. I'd rather spend money on a product I know is great than keep trying different cheaper products and find they don't work. And that adds up in cost also. This is the shampoo and brand for me for now on!!!!!!!

There will be an adjustment time for sure, but you will thank me after a month! I only use this product about 2 times a week and it is good for me, and will last a really long time.

column6: Its like connecting with a former lover
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2018
column14: NOTE! Please read my review for Nioxin System 2 conditioner; the review is very relevant. Long story short: I was a loyal user of Nioxin System 2 for years. Then one day the magic stopped; my hair became blah. I jumped off the Nioxin train and started using other popular hair products. I researched what in the heck happened to Nioxin. My hair was the same so something had to have changed with the product. I found lots of comments posted by unhappy users on lots of web sites other than Amazon; although there are lots on Amazon. I read Nioxin was bought by P&G, who in turn, changed the ingredients and moved production to Mexico. But like a long lost love, Nioxin System 2 always held a special place in my heart. One day while perusing Amazon I noticed something different about Nioxin. Some of the products - not all - had new labeling. So I am thinking maybe the product changed also. Now keep in mind, I am talking about the conditioner, although all the product labeling for System 2 has been revamped. I decided to give Nioxin another chance and ordered the conditioner. To my great surprise, my hair returned to its former glory. The conditioner - the stuff with the new labeling - shows it is now made in the USA! The cleanser I bought, with the old labeling, was still made in Mexico but, again, my hair is spectacular. here is the moral of my story - I assume any product with the new labeling is now made in the USA. If you are thinking about ditching Nioxin or left Nioxin because the product of the past sucked, I suggest buying the stuff in the new look bottles and give it another shot. Like me, you might be pleasantly surprised.

column6: Looking for something to help with greasy, color treated hair? You found it.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2018
column14: I have been excited to leave a review for this product! I dye my hair but unfortunately have a greasy scalp. It's hard to find a shampoo that helps greasy hair that is color treated. THIS IS IT. My color doesn't fall out and it helps with greasy hair! Obviously, there is no product that can completely eliminate the problem of having greasy hair. It's important to have realistic expectations. Try using this product for a month and then evaluate your results. I still need to use dry shampoo, but I have tried a lot of products and have found nothing better than this. It's also important to follow the instructions. Massage slowly into scalp and let sit for 2-3 minutes. Repeat process. You must do this process twice or you will not see the results you're looking for. You'll notice the first time you put it in, there will be little to no foam/soap. The second time, you'll see LOTS of foam/soap. This is how you know it's working! All in all, I think this is great product to help greasy hair and to maintain your color.

column6: The Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner are amazing products
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018
column14: I decided to order the Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner for severely damaged hair cause I was having a lot of hair breakage and shedding and I absolutely resented hair wash days. My hair was brittle and seemed always dry no matter what products I would put on it. I thought that I would have had to cut my hair and start completely over. However, when my products arrived, I could not wait to give them a try. I love the smells. Very nice and not powerful. I washed my hair twice with the Nexxus Shampoo, first time just the scalp, and the second wash, the hair itself. The way that my hair reacted to this shampoo was breathtaking! My curls appeared and believe it or not, I was able to pull a comb through my thick, natural, 4C  hair!! I have never, ever been able to do this before while washing. Barely any hair was coming out in my comb! I had not even used the conditioner yet. I just had to stop and look in the mirror and talk to myself saying, "Omg, I cannot believe this"! I have never, ever experienced a shampoo doing my hair like this before. After I completely rinsed the shampoo from my hair, I moved on to the Nexxus Conditioner. Even more amazing. It stated to leave on the hair for 3 min, but I sat under a hooded dryer for about 10min with the conditioner on my hair, under a plastic cap. Once my time was up, I rinsed away all of the conditioner. My hair was so manageable!! I was able to comb and section it to do my bantu knots and allow my hair to dry overnight. After washing my hair, it only took me about 30 min to get it  all done to dry. I have never been able to complete this process this quickly before! I am highly satisfied with these products! Even though they are  expensive products, I'm hooked and will be purchasing again. I told my mom about my experience and am ready to try it on her hair also, to see if she gets the same experience and satisfaction that I got. Thank you Nexxus for such wonderful products, and thank you Amazon for carrying them. Definitely a must try on the Nexxus Keraphix Shampoo and Conditioner for Severely damaged hair. This is my first time ever writing a review on a product. That's how pleased I was with these products!!

column6: HEADS UP: New product, not only "New Look"
column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2017
column14: I've been using the Andalou Argan & Sweet Orange shampoo and conditioner for over 6 months and my hair was the healthiest it had ever been. My hairdresser even commented on it, more than once. But recently, Andalou changed this product...check the ingredients! It's not just a "New Look" as advertised on the bottle, but it's a whole new formula. One of the main reasons I started using this product was because it had very low ratings on the Environmental Working Group's website (lower ratings mean less harmful products). This new version isn't rated or certified yet, but now contains ingredients like Sodium Lauroyl Sarcosinate and Cocamidopropyl Betaine (higher ratings on EWG, not good!). The new product also makes my hair feel sticky even after blow drying, as though there is some remaining residue after washing. I absolutely loved the old version, but I'm so disappointed with this new version that I'm now looking for alternative products.

Mind you male pattern baldness does not run in my family nor mothers and my fathers hair is like a helmet which does not thin, only turns grey. I digress. Do not buy this shampoo. column6: Dry hair ppl purchase a hair mask to add with this product!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021
column14: I gave 2 stars for softness because it dried out my hair (African type grade). But, smells good and as a licensed cosmetologist, I xan say that the tingly feeling helped loosen my scalp to massage my scalp during shampoo. (Massage keeps blood flow to decrease un-natural hairloss.) I also used the matching conditioner. Which also gave a very good tingly feel. Now for those who hair is naturally dry, do not run from this product. Purchase a good conditioning hair mask and apply before the matching contioner or after which ever you perfer. I do before to hydrate easier. When your out add some hydrating leave in creams. One of my favorite is butter cream by "As I Am". For Ethnic hair types I would not use this product everyday, due to the drying effect it gives. I would love to see the makes create a product that moisturizes as well for ethnic hair or even create a hair mask for dry hair. Even for Caucasian hair I would use a light pea size oil on palm when done, rub vigorously on palm and add to whole hair to keep the fly aways from looking like a over permed 80's curls. Overall I gave a 4 stars due to the overdrying effect it gives (that is to any hair type) but for Caucasian the conditioner should give a 5 syar effect. Would I purchase again? So far yes. I always do a re-review after a couple months. I feel this product is good for a youtube channel review, so I may do it there as well. Review would be if this product actually works? I can‚Äôt say it helps with hair loss necessarily, but I have seen more baby hairs growing recently so maybe it does a little. Mainly it will help with the overall appearance of your hair loss. It makes hair look super clean and thus thicker when you‚Äôre using it. Sometimes it can be hard to make thinner hair look clean as it always wants to look stringy. column6: I was more than pleased with the outcome of my hair
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2017
column14: AAAAWWWEESOME!  I used these products a few days before my college homecoming.  The compliments just kept coming.  These products worked very well for my hair type.  I am aware that some people stated that the products didn't work well for them.  I used the products as specified per the directions as well as watched several videos of the products used mostly successfully as well as some unsuccessfully.  I was more than pleased with the outcome of my hair.  It was so bouncy, shiny, and full of life.  It looked so healthy and felt amazing.  It only lasted for about a week, could have been longer if it did not rain where I am.  The moisture in the air caused my hair to not hold a curl easily, however, it did not completely draw up, it still took a week or more to revert back to my natural curl on its own.  I eventually just wet it so it would curl up in its natural state.  I also tried it in my daughter's hair, using the same process.  It lasted for all of a day because she's very active and sweated it out, however for special events, I will use these products for our natural hair to switch it up a bit.  I really enjoyed the change and am looking forward to using this product again.  Incidentally, this isn't like a perm, where you can only use it every 6 - 8 weeks, you can use it every time you want your hair straight and it won't damage it.  The shampoo does make your hair feel a little dryer than usual, but the silk conditioner compensates for that once you rinse the shampoo out and apply the conditioner.  Your hair really will feel like silk after one application.  Some people resolve to use just the conditioner as a detangling formula, but since that isn't my issue, I am more than happy to use all the products as recommended to get the desired effect.  E'tae ROCKS!!!

column6: Made scalp worse. Left hair flat and crunchy.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019
column14: Based upon all the amazing reviews I was REALLY hoping this would work for my scalp. Unfortunately, it did the complete opposite. Also, even with using a great conditioner it left my hair crunchy, not easy to comb through and flat. Ugh! Also note, beside the sulfates, which I really didn‚Äôt mind, there is Sodium Benzoate which is actually worse and is carcinogenic. Also the description of this shampoo is VERY deceiving. You think all of those amazing botanicals are going to be in the shampoo and they are not. They are in the scalp lotion which I also purchased. I will write a separate review for that as well. Lastly, it is really disappointing because I am fully supportive of women owned companies as I own one myself. Unfortunately when people don‚Äôt practice what they preach, that is really disappointing. All that research, etc to go into this product to result in using horrible toxic ingredients. column6: Fake. Do not buy, batch numbers from 1999
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2021
column14: I was alerted to the fact that something was off when the smell wasn't classic biolage. The second indicator was that the labels had deviations from eachother, and weird spacing. Third indicator was the bottom of the bottles--said 12/02. So december 2002? Wayyyyy too old to be selling. Just because I was already in detective mode- I checked the batch numbers online. I wish I got screenshots because i swear the batch number was from 1999. I'm 27, that would make these products either 22 years old with fresh labels OR, these were just a really good scam because they used expired batch numbers to avoid being traced by Matrix. I reported them to customer service. So long story short, I returned them. Do not buy.

I will no longer by products advertised as Kerastase on Amazon.  This includes Kerastase products from all other vendors advertised on Amazon.  Now I'm dealing with the hair loss. I chose the apple cider vinegar scent because of the "harsh swimming conditions", and due to it being summer, I thought this would help maintain frizz.  Apple cider vinegar has always made me nauseous, but this shampoo doesn't have a smell (unless you're trying to smell for it, then you can BARELY smell the ACV).  I wash my hair once a week with this scent and use The Honest Co.'s fragrance free lavender conditioner with it.  I also use a shower cap on the days I'm not washing my hair to prevent the shower's humidity and accidental splashes from making my scalp itch.  This has become a DREAM COMBO for me!  My hair has never felt softer or smelled nicer.  I highly recommend to anyone looking for a new shampoo and a great product that's fragrance free!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2020
column14: I have really fine, low porosity hair. It had started to look really greasy, stuck to my head, and almost spongy feeling. I found this, and it's been great. It has soy protein, and it's like #6 on the list of ingredients which makes it so it's not protein overload. Also because it's a shampoo the protein is actually able to penetrate my low porosity hair. My hair is starting to get it's volume back. If you find that this shampoo works great at first, but then your hair starts to dry out and get crunchy it's because it doesn't want anymore protein. Just take a break from using it. The conditioner doesn't contain protein tho, so that's always fine to use.

column14: So, I am the sort who shampoos every day or nearly every day (although since last summer I've begun substituting one of those daily shampoos with a conditioning treatment about once a week) because my hair really bothers me when it isn't clean, and I just cannot stand it when it doesn't feel clean. I generally use a leave-in conditioner or detangler after shampooing (and since Burt's Bees doesn't have one of those for humans I've used Mane and Tail's detangler spray). Yesterday my hair looked AMAZING but it felt very blergh, which sort of makes sense because I've read that dirty hair actually holds a hairstyle better than clean hair. I read another review from someone who said they felt like their hair was both shampooed and conditioned with just this shampoo, and on the theory that I might have overconditioned my hair yesterday I used the spray detangler sparingly today. It still doesn't feel clean, and going back to what I just said, if my hair doesn't feel clean I'm going to be sitting there wishing I could stop what I'm doing, find a flow of clean water somewhere and shampoo my hair. Which isn't really conducive to doing social events that involve presenting myself as a functioning human being to other people. For me, my hair has to be clean first, and looking a certain way is gravy. Unfortunately, this shampoo isn't fulfilling that for me. column6: Finally a dandruff treatment that works
column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2016
column14: I have struggled with dandruff for years and nothing seemed to work. I saw a dermatologist who suggested that I try Targum as well as other prescription strength shampoos and treatments. These did not work for me. I resorted to rinsing with diluted apple cider vinegar and that seemed to  heal some of my scalp flakiness, redness, and scaling but never for very long, simply for getting the symptoms under control. I found out about this Sachajuan shampoo while researching my next remedy and someone mentioned it in a post for another product. I don't know how else I would have found it. It works perfectly. After the first wash i noticed a difference and after the second I no longer had the persistent signs of dandruff. At all. I have been using this about twice a week for two months and my scalp is now healthy. My hair is also much brighter and softer. The scent is lovely and the bottle is packaged beautifully and doesn't scream "dandruff shampoo". I am so grateful that I found this and i hope that they don't change formula and that it continues to work well for me. I will continue to buy this as my regular shampoo and will eventually try the conditioner too.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021

I had tried everything, and switched shampoos multiple times. I was buying Nexxus because it was the only thing that came close to giving me a "clean" after shower feel. Even so, I would wash then dry my hair (a lengthy process for those with long hair) and still it would be oily. I was beyond frustrated. Finally I came across this shampoo while doing some heavy research, and it has solved the problem. It is pricey, and as others have said it is difficult to lather, so you end up using more. But it is worth it to me to have a scalp free of oil, without the damage of drying out my hair. Not sure if it's worth mentioning, but I have dyed blonde hair, and have had zero issues. So very thankful for this product.

My entire forehead and hairline is broken out (like literally so bad). It has been almost a month and it is still not gone. I do have fairly sensitive skin but I have never experienced anything like this. I am not sure if I got sent a knockoff or what, but this is clearly waaaay too chemically and seriously harmed my skin. Buyer beware.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019
column14: I used to represent a fairly large hair care brand and overtime started to recognise what ingredients do what in a product. Now for the squeamish there‚Äôs an ingredient that some people can have an allergic reaction too, though it‚Äôs fairly low down the list which is called Diazolidinyl urea. It‚Äôs a formaldehyde, though it‚Äôs widely used in beauty product as an anti microbial. If that‚Äôs a worry then this is not for you, however I‚Äôm ok with living dangerously. I like a lot of OGX shampoos but this one tends to put moisture where you don‚Äôt need it which is closer to the scalp and none where you do need it which is on the ends of your hair. I suspect any porosity in your hair can‚Äôt hold it and it rinses out. I‚Äôve got pretty fine hair and prefer the roots of my hair to be pretty squeaky clean to get some root lift which this doesn‚Äôt achieve. Of course it smells nice, but that‚Äôs about all I like. I‚Äôd say if you got pretty healthy medium straight hair this may be worth trying.

column6: Olive Oil Organic Root Stimulator Products are AWESOME!!!!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2011
column14: I am an African American who has struggled with unmanagable hair all of my life.  Although my hair is thick and almost impossible to damage, it just won't curl, won't straighten--basically won't do anything but poof and take years (and cost hundreds of dollars) to braid.  By the time I was 15 years old, I learned to braid my hair myself (to save money) and either wore braids or shaved my hair super short, because those were the only ways I could quickly manage my hair everyday.  I was given some of O.R.S.'s olive oil samples at a beauty supply store while buying extensions to braid my hair one day.  On a whim, I decided to wash, condition, and moisturize my hair with only the olive oil samples.  I was AMAZED at how soft and manageable my hair was after.  I decided to add a dab of curling mousse just to see what would happen, and I haven't braided my hair sense.  I have a wonderful, curly, natural 'do that doesn't frizz or poof with every subtle climate change.  I have never had so many compliments on my hair before in my life (and I usually get a lot of compliments for my braids).  These products are pure gold AND they're so reasonsably-priced!  I'm not realy one to suggest beauty products to my friends and family because I feel like everyone is different and different things work for different people, but I haven't met a person yet who couldn't use SOME organic root stimulator hair product. I've told all of my friends and family about them, and everyone who has tried the products have loved them.  They work on all kinds of African American hair--natural, relaxed, texturized, even curl-perms.  And I've even read reviews from people of other ethnic backgrounds raving about the products, so DEFINITELY try them!  And if you don't like them (HIGHLY UNLIKELY), you will not have even lost $10; you can't go wrong!

column13: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
column14: Cleansing power is fairly strong.  You can feel that your hair is squeaky to the touch after shampoo.  The conditioner is hard to rinse off, because it includes acrylate copolymer (a plastic coating for your hair) in the ingredients. Unilever chemists have no idea what constitutes a natural product.  You will also find dipropylene glycol and ppg, which are thin petroleum jellies, in the ingredients.  Add sodium benzoate and citric acid, which combine to form benzene, you are exposed to chemicals that have no place in a "natural" product.

I rinsed my hair and did not use conditioner (I typically do use conditioner).  It was not easy to comb through my hair.  When my hair dried, it did look pretty good and the smell was very mild.  The next day I repeated everything but this time I used my normal conditioner.  My hair was easier to comb through and softer.  I would bring this on vacation because it is easy to pack but I'm not sure that I would use it on a regular basis because I really don't like the smell when shampooing. I've written directly to Garnier but have received no response. I won't be buying this product again.

column6: Wonderful Natural Soap that Smells AMAZING!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2015
column14: I wanted to wait a few days after purchasing this body wash before leaving an honest review - mainly to test out a couple areas. I recently decided to give a natural soap a try after noticing that my skin has become very sensitive to many things. Of course to begin with I just thought I needed a soap with "extra moisturizers" or something fancy like that, but it wasn't cutting it. I began to surf across amazon to see what the highest rated natural/organic body washes were, and this one was the top of the list. The reviews were supremely positive and the main thing that caught my eye was how many people were stating that this soap left their skin feeling soft, smooth, and hydrated. After purchasing, the product arrived VERY quickly, which I was happy with as always. I have now used this soap on three separate occasions, not only just on the body but on the face as well. Like the other reviewers, I noticed that upon leaving the shower, I didn't have that ridiculously uncomfortable "need to put on lotion now" feeling. My legs were usually craving some sort of moisturizer when I stepped out of the shower, but it seems to have subsided with this product. The soap lathers well, goes a long way (I feel that 1-2 pumps is perfect for the entire body) and smells absolutely INCREDIBLE. I am in love with the natural list of ingredients and am very excited to see how this plays out in the future, as well as recommending it to others in my family. I definitely think I'll be continuing to make this body wash one of my "Healthy Splurges".

column6: I don't get why we don't rate the cleaning power?

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2021

Torturous product. I do find that if I follow the wash with a good rinsing soap like Dr. Bronners, you can eliminate almost all of these particles....I find no benefit to this product whatsoever.

column6: I can‚Äôt believe I am reviewing body wash, but...GAME CHANGER

column6: LOVE this product !! Helps with Psoriasis

column6: The best for dry, itchy, winter skin!  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!  Love this!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2017
column14: Itchy skin?  TRY THIS!  I got this on a whim for a Pantry order and waited months to use it.  I initially purchased it for my girls that get dry skin during the winter, but I was the one that was dying from itchy skin one night.  Next morning, I used this, and it was a miracle.  I was able to go to bed that night without itching.  I've been using it for every shower and it has made a huge difference.  As I've aged, my skin has grown dryer and dryer, and this is even helping with keeping my hands moisturized during the day.  It comes out like baby oil (without making the tub slippery), and I had initially used it with a washcloth, but that seems to impede the ability to spread it around.  Use it without a washcloth and it spreads better.  Again, does not make the shower/tub slippery.  I've been using another brand I've been faithful to for years now that is gentle, as I have allergic reactions to body soap with junk dyes and fragrance.  This may be my new best friend during the winter season!

column6: Probably decent if you get a real one and don't mind castor scent.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
column14: The scent is awful but I didn't get a counterfeit product. The smell is just awful. Do me a favor and go sniff castor oil and castor seed before buying this because that's what it smells like and I personally hated that. If you like that smell, you should be fine. It does seem good for sensitive skin, with a slippy feel, almost no lather and nothing in it to really irritate that I can see. It fixed my itch problem from the previous body wash. However, I just couldn't use it for long because of the smell. Since I don't have a medical skin condition, I had the luxury of switching, so I did and never looked back. I went for Aveeno's basic body wash with oat, if you're wondering.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2018
column14: The smell and texture of the body wash are more like those of laundry detergent than of the real product.

column6: Verified consumer and product user since 2014. Quality Product for Sensitive Skin and Eczema minus the expensive pricetag
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2017
column14: Our son has extremely sensitive skin.  In 2014, he had a major skin breakout that took us several doctor visits to diagnose.  Two doctors diagnosed him with eczema and referred us to a specialist.  The physicians were adamant that skin conditions are extremely hard to treat.  They wanted us to realize that this would not be easy.  The doctor gave us samples of two products.  One sample was this product and the other was Aquaphor Baby Wash & Shampoo.  We use the Eucerin in the bath water and the Aquaphor to wash our munchkin.  It worked! No pricey specialist, medications, or creams.  This did the trick and has work for years.  When the weather changes and we have more severe flair ups we use CeraVe Moisturizing Cream.  The doctor will sometimes prescribe a prescription steroid to mix with it.  These three things have been life savers for our little boy.  Skin conditions are tough to treat. Medications and treatment can be extremely expensive and often yield no benefit.  This is a review from a mom that these products work.  Yes, the Eucerin is oily.  It's an oil to moisturize the skin.  No, we have not ever had problems with it smelling, but I guess that's more of an individual biased.  That said, it doesn't have a bad smell or a great smell.  It's really plain, but if you think scented products typically cause more problems.  The bottom line it works.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019
column14: My daughter has severe eczema. We have used Dove sensitive skin body wash or bar soap on her for years. I saw this Eucerian on Amazon Pantry,it had a good coupon and the reviews were great. I am so glad I bought it for her!! Her skin feels less dry than it did with any other cleanser we have used. Her eczema is caused by a combination of food and environmental allergies. So this product hasn't fixed her skin, but it is by far the best the  body wash for moisturizing her skin. You can trust our opinion , because we have tried EVERY SINGLE sensitive skin, fragrance free , and "eczema board certified" body soaps out there.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2018
column14: I've been on a hunt for affordable, effective vegan-friendly products for the last year and a half. I was excited when I found this product, especially since it was at an add on price. column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2018

I find that it matters well on a shower sea sponge and my skin feels clean after. column6: I didn't even realize how drying my old soap was until I used this product!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
column14: So I'd been using Dr. Bronner's castile liquid soaps because I have multiple chemical and fragrance sensitivities; and most of what's out there commercially is too drying, has *way* too many chemicals for me to trust them; AND are tested on animals, to boot - yuck! Sorry, but it's true.  And Mrs. Meyers Lemon Verbena is the only cleaner that has got the power to cut the stink completely, so that it my deep-clean staple.  After a day of deep-cleaning, I always want to go take a nice hot shower so I do not smell like I've been cleaning all day...and well, the lemon-verbena body wash is kind of counter productive in that task.  So, while the body wash itself is great, I really have to say no to this scent while bathing.  The honeysuckle and lavender washes are much more suited to not smelling like I've been cleaning all day.

column6: I wish I would've known that this product worked so good.

column14: I am 36yo white male (for an idea of my skin type).  I used the original orange scent when I was 18-23 when I would get acne on my back and sometimes thighs. column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2021

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2021
column14: My daughters and I all have sensitive skin. This is the body wash for you if you also have sensitive skin. I love that it is a clean body wash without added fragrances but still smells really nice.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2018
column14: No.63 lotion! Not a lot of reviews on it. Firstly, I use the No.63 bar soap in the shower, and I wanted to pair it with its corresponding lotion; therefore, here I am with my review.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2018
column14: I only recently discovered milled soaps. I never realized what the point was. Well, the point is that triple (and quadruple) milled soaps last a long time and feel luxurious since they are made with good quality fats and other ingredients and don't dry the skin. I have had this bar for almost three months and use it every day rubbed multiple times onto a washcloth. I can't believe how economical  it is. column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2019

column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2017
column14: The first thing you notice about this soap is its incredible scent. Warm, sweet and delicious yet manly. The puck is very hard and I would not be surprised to hear that it's triple milled. This puck will last you a long time!!! It does not need a lot of water and immediately and easily provides copious amounts of quality slick lather and when I say quality, I mean QUALITY!!! The ingredients list has everything you could want in a shaving soap and non of what you don't. Slick and protective with excellent post shave characteristics. I'm mostly a tallow guy but this soap performs every bit as good as the best tallow soaps out there. In fact, along with Tabac and cella, this is one of my 3 favorite all time soaps and believe me when I say I have a lot...

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
column14: With the decent reviews I purchased this figuring whats the worst that could happen.  Well, those are famous last words.  This does NOT lather at all.  The tube isnt the biggest out there, but thats fine since I knew the size I was purchasing.  However I basically squeezed out half the tube, and still could not get this "soap" to lather.  You can use a small dollop of Taylor of Old Bond Street, or The Art of Shaving to get a massive lather.  This however, was an absolute mess.  HALF THE TUBE, and I still could not get a lather.  All I could manage was a runny soapy mess.  Fortunately it was slick enough where I was able to shave with no nicks or cuts.  The scent is pleasant, but I cant help feeling that I have smelled it somewhere else before.  Reminds me of a soap in the family of an Irish Spring.  That also caught me by surprise.  I expected a warm, spicy scent, but this is not.  I honestly double checked this product thinking I had been sent the after shave, but no - it's the shave cream.  This is very disappointing, and its quite possible my product is expired or just bad.

column6: Verified consumer and product user since 2014. Quality Product for Sensitive Skin and Eczema minus the expensive pricetag
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2017
column14: Our son has extremely sensitive skin.  In 2014, he had a major skin breakout that took us several doctor visits to diagnose.  Two doctors diagnosed him with eczema and referred us to a specialist.  The physicians were adamant that skin conditions are extremely hard to treat.  They wanted us to realize that this would not be easy.  The doctor gave us samples of two products.  One sample was this product and the other was Aquaphor Baby Wash & Shampoo.  We use the Eucerin in the bath water and the Aquaphor to wash our munchkin.  It worked! No pricey specialist, medications, or creams.  This did the trick and has work for years.  When the weather changes and we have more severe flair ups we use CeraVe Moisturizing Cream.  The doctor will sometimes prescribe a prescription steroid to mix with it.  These three things have been life savers for our little boy.  Skin conditions are tough to treat. Medications and treatment can be extremely expensive and often yield no benefit.  This is a review from a mom that these products work.  Yes, the Eucerin is oily.  It's an oil to moisturize the skin.  No, we have not ever had problems with it smelling, but I guess that's more of an individual biased.  That said, it doesn't have a bad smell or a great smell.  It's really plain, but if you think scented products typically cause more problems.  The bottom line it works.

So this product hasn't fixed her skin, but it is by far the best the  body wash for moisturizing her skin. column6: Men's Energy 3 in 1 Do Not Recommend
column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2019
column14: I blame myself for buying this. I should have known from past experiences 3 in 1 soaps are never good, which is why it's two stars, the soap itself is a one star. I bought the nivea men's active clean with charcoal a couple times and I like it, 4.1 out of 5, great musky smell, medium thick consistency and nice lather, one major con is if I don't lotion after then my skin gets super dry, I have skin that a light consistency lotion is great, and the problem of finding a lot of lotions to heavy so I can imagine the dry skin problem being a nightmare for people who need their thick creams and lotions. With the Men's Energy 3 in 1 the dry skin problem wasn't really a problem maybe like a third of how it was/is with the Nivea Active Clean. The smell of the Energy 3 in 1 is the same not similar to but the same as the combination of the soap used to wash your car and Dove dish soap with a splash of mint that I feel was only noticeable because I smelled the Energy 3 in 1 prior to using it and as mint does made my nose hairs stand up straight but that being said the Energy 3 in 1 mint smell was very very mild and overpowerd by the scent of car wash and dish soap, gives me a headache just thinking about the smell. The consistency is light and with a transparent blue color reminds me of car soap. Lather is OK I find myself using more soap with the Energy 3 in 1 than normal because the consistency is so light, like a third more mabye. What drew me in to the Energy 3 in 1 was because when I read Energy and Mint I imagined myself after a workout or after work taking a hot shower with the smell of strong mint overpowering my senses and the mint working it's magic and relaxing and soothing my muscles, basically aromatherapy and relaxing. I got the smell of car soap with dish soap and some mint you could hardly tell was mint, a headache, 3 bottles of headache. Just what every man wants to smell like a car wash and freshly washed dishes. Used the Energy 3 in 1 as shampoo, don't even try it doesn't shampoo well at all as you can expect from any 3 in 1 bodywash product. What's the difference between the Nivea Men's Energy 3 in 1 and Nivea Men's Cool if they both contain Menthol? Anyone know? Please no replies of the Nivea Men's Cool is ICY Menthol.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020
column14: I have sensitive skin and if I use other soap or body wash, I either feel dirty or dried out. I'm sure that there are expensive body washes that optimizes your skin condition, but those typically cost a lot more than I'd be willing to pay for. So, I hunt for cheaper products that gets the job done. I've used dove, olay, bath and body works product, body shop products, myers, etc... I really enjoyed using products from body shop because they smell amazing, but they are also not very cost-effective (small containers with a substantial price tag for a body wash). I normally don't use Dial products because they dry my skin out, but this particular body wash has just the right mix. It moisturizes, cleans, smells amazing and it is sold at a reasonable and affordable price point. If you have eczema or other skin condition, I can't say that this will be a "cure" for that; however, I noticed that my skin did not flare as often. I got a three month subscription because these are hard to find in stores. I used to get these from walmart, but they go out of stock from time to time and there is not much price difference even if you get it through amazon.

column6: Overwhelming Orange - I Ordered Green Tea Lemongrass
column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2018
column14: Lathers well, cleans well, and works well as a shave gel. I ordered Green Tea Lemongrass scent, however, it smells like orange. Not just a hint, it's a smack you in the face with righteous indignation ORANGE! For many, this is not a big deal, may even be awesome to feel like a major league pitcher threw an orange fresh from the tree at 90 mph that slammed right between your eyes while standing in the middle of a Florida orange grove. However, I detest the fragrance (also the taste/flavor) of oranges. Needless to say when my husband was decanting it into a smaller pump dispenser for our bathroom he was shocked that I purchased something orange, his favorite. I thought I could deal since it was open, and my orange aficionado husband was happy...and again, it was already open. I was wrong. The scent is not light. However, the nausea from the fragrance has really shortened my shower time in the morning and I am also much more alert as I am trying to keep my stomach settled. I would take off 2 stars for the fragrance (I have a true disdain for oranges) but the scent doesn't linger on your skin so since it's just 3-10 minutes a day in the underworld I kick 1 star. Everything else about the body wash is great, but it's hard to appreciate it while under olfactory assault.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2018
column14: This product says that it is gentle and "sulfate free".  The second ingredient listed is olefin sulfonate .  While it is not sodium laurel sulfate which is usually in soaps and shampoos, it is just as harsh.  This product is very hard on eyes and other sensitive areas.  I got a mild chemical burn in a very sensitive part of my body.  The smell is not anything like lemongrass.  It smells more like a combination of oranges and musk.  Not an appealing aroma at all.  This product does lather and clean well.  If it had been branded as a hand soap, I probably would have been OK with it.  But it is much too harsh for a body wash.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2018
column14: Technically, a sulfonate is not a sulfate, but they are irritating to skin, and that's what I was trying to avoid by buying this product.  Amazon clearly does zero vetting on how products are advertised, so as far as consumer protection, you are still in the wild, wild west.  Buyer beware.  Only after opening, and noticing the weird way the liquid flowed did I check the ingredient list.  Sure, no sulfates, but saying that is totally misleading.  Cheap crap, worse than Suave shampoo.

column6: Proceed with caution! This product gave me a really *BAD* rash/skin irritation.

Extremely itchy, swollen and red. It was so bad, I had to run out to pick up some antihistamines. Luckily, the medicine worked, and about 3-4 hours later I was OK.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2021
column14: I personally like this stuff, it works great in my opinion.  I have read a lot about the smell, which some people have described as smelling like gasoline, I don't know about that.  It does have a unique scent to it, I can see a hint of diesel type scent if you are looking for it but really I got used to the scent quickly and I actually learned to really like it.  As far as body acne it works great, I get a few pimples from working out and this stuff really breaks down the oil on your skin and cleanses better than any of the cheaper body washes I've used.  The scent doesn't hang with you either, this isn't like axe or old spice both of which I find way overpowering even hours later.  If you don't mind paying about a dollar an ounce then get this stuff.  It does also come with three caps, one with a push dispenser, a flip top cap, and the solid bottle cap it ships with.  I personally like the flip cap, you get the best control over how much you use so you don't waste any.  Also this stuff does not lather like regular body wash like suave or dove, but lather isn't as important to me as feeling clean and it does that very well!!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2017
column14: Itchy skin?  TRY THIS!  I got this on a whim for a Pantry order and waited months to use it. It does seem good for sensitive skin, with a slippy feel, almost no lather and nothing in it to really irritate that I can see. It fixed my itch problem from the previous body wash. column6: Verified consumer and product user since 2014. Quality Product for Sensitive Skin and Eczema minus the expensive pricetag
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2017
column14: Our son has extremely sensitive skin.  In 2014, he had a major skin breakout that took us several doctor visits to diagnose.  Two doctors diagnosed him with eczema and referred us to a specialist.  The physicians were adamant that skin conditions are extremely hard to treat.  They wanted us to realize that this would not be easy.  The doctor gave us samples of two products.  One sample was this product and the other was Aquaphor Baby Wash & Shampoo.  We use the Eucerin in the bath water and the Aquaphor to wash our munchkin.  It worked! No pricey specialist, medications, or creams.  This did the trick and has work for years.  When the weather changes and we have more severe flair ups we use CeraVe Moisturizing Cream.  The doctor will sometimes prescribe a prescription steroid to mix with it.  These three things have been life savers for our little boy.  Skin conditions are tough to treat. Medications and treatment can be extremely expensive and often yield no benefit.  This is a review from a mom that these products work.  Yes, the Eucerin is oily.  It's an oil to moisturize the skin.  No, we have not ever had problems with it smelling, but I guess that's more of an individual biased.  That said, it doesn't have a bad smell or a great smell.  It's really plain, but if you think scented products typically cause more problems.  The bottom line it works.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2019
column14: My daughter has severe eczema. We have used Dove sensitive skin body wash or bar soap on her for years. I saw this Eucerian on Amazon Pantry,it had a good coupon and the reviews were great. I am so glad I bought it for her!! Her skin feels less dry than it did with any other cleanser we have used. Her eczema is caused by a combination of food and environmental allergies. So this product hasn't fixed her skin, but it is by far the best the  body wash for moisturizing her skin. You can trust our opinion , because we have tried EVERY SINGLE sensitive skin, fragrance free , and "eczema board certified" body soaps out there.

column6: Overwhelming Orange - I Ordered Green Tea Lemongrass
column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2018
column14: Lathers well, cleans well, and works well as a shave gel. I ordered Green Tea Lemongrass scent, however, it smells like orange. Not just a hint, it's a smack you in the face with righteous indignation ORANGE! For many, this is not a big deal, may even be awesome to feel like a major league pitcher threw an orange fresh from the tree at 90 mph that slammed right between your eyes while standing in the middle of a Florida orange grove. However, I detest the fragrance (also the taste/flavor) of oranges. Needless to say when my husband was decanting it into a smaller pump dispenser for our bathroom he was shocked that I purchased something orange, his favorite. I thought I could deal since it was open, and my orange aficionado husband was happy...and again, it was already open. I was wrong. The scent is not light. However, the nausea from the fragrance has really shortened my shower time in the morning and I am also much more alert as I am trying to keep my stomach settled. I would take off 2 stars for the fragrance (I have a true disdain for oranges) but the scent doesn't linger on your skin so since it's just 3-10 minutes a day in the underworld I kick 1 star. Everything else about the body wash is great, but it's hard to appreciate it while under olfactory assault.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2018
column14: This product says that it is gentle and "sulfate free".  The second ingredient listed is olefin sulfonate .  While it is not sodium laurel sulfate which is usually in soaps and shampoos, it is just as harsh.  This product is very hard on eyes and other sensitive areas.  I got a mild chemical burn in a very sensitive part of my body.  The smell is not anything like lemongrass.  It smells more like a combination of oranges and musk.  Not an appealing aroma at all.  This product does lather and clean well.  If it had been branded as a hand soap, I probably would have been OK with it.  But it is much too harsh for a body wash.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2018
column14: Technically, a sulfonate is not a sulfate, but they are irritating to skin, and that's what I was trying to avoid by buying this product.  Amazon clearly does zero vetting on how products are advertised, so as far as consumer protection, you are still in the wild, wild west.  Buyer beware.  Only after opening, and noticing the weird way the liquid flowed did I check the ingredient list.  Sure, no sulfates, but saying that is totally misleading.  Cheap crap, worse than Suave shampoo.

I personally like the flip cap, you get the best control over how much you use so you don't waste any. column14: I personally like this stuff, it works great in my opinion.  I have read a lot about the smell, which some people have described as smelling like gasoline, I don't know about that. As far as body acne it works great, I get a few pimples from working out and this stuff really breaks down the oil on your skin and cleanses better than any of the cheaper body washes I've used.  The scent doesn't hang with you either, this isn't like axe or old spice both of which I find way overpowering even hours later.  If you don't mind paying about a dollar an ounce then get this stuff.  It does also come with three caps, one with a push dispenser, a flip top cap, and the solid bottle cap it ships with.  I personally like the flip cap, you get the best control over how much you use so you don't waste any. column6: Best Satsuma Shower Gel for a Great Price!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2017
column14: This is the fourth one I've ordered in this size, and no one (including myself) has ever disliked this awesome fragrance and size. In the past, I wrapped one as a gift inside the package Amazon shipped it in. As we were driving, I'm all, "Why do I smell Satsuma?" We get to Christmas, and it's gift time. My best friend peels the wrapping paper back only to be bombarded by Satsuma fragrance. She says excitedly while opening,"Well, I certainly know what this is-EEEWWWW it's EVERYWHERE!" I peer inside the box, and the plastic inside is soaked with soapy shower gel that is dripping everywhere. She throws the box away, washes the gel off the bottle and her hands in the kitchen sink, and promptly brings it to her shower so it doesn't leak anywhere else. It was slippery, so she nearly dropped it on her foot, and it's very heavy. Ouch! How embarrassing! When it's for me, it's no big deal. But as a gift, I expect it to be perfect. So this time, I ordered from a different seller. Not only is the bottle design different, the gel lathers well and smells better than any other Satsuma shower gel I've gotten on Amazon. Now, my husband is using it. He opened the bathroom door yesterday, and I asked if he was enjoying my new body wash as much as I was. His face reddened, and he didn't answer as he scurried off. I take that as a yes!

column14: I am a fan of PiperWai's natural deodorant, so I am really pleased to see that they are branching out into other products like these body washes. While they aren't 100% completely organic and/or natural ingredients, PiperWai does try to use as high a quantity of natural ingredients as they can. For anyone with sensitive skin or trouble with skincare products loaded with additives and preservatives, this brand is a good choice. The unscented body wash is preferable for anyone that doesn't like pefumey products or is bothered by heavy scents. It has a mild 'soapy' scent, but nothing that lingers on skin or that will make your shower seem like you are breathing in nothing but fragrance vapors. You can also add a little of your favorite essential oil scent (or even favorite eau de toilette or eau de parfum) to create a custom scented body wash. The ginger chamomile body wash has a pleasant though quite light scent of fresh ginger. It's a refreshing way to start your morning off, but the scent doesn't last once you are done bathing.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020
column14: This is my favorite body wash, and has been since it came out many years ago. Unfortunately my local store of choice stopped selling this particular Dial scent. So I have turned to Amazon. I ordered 2 bottles. Thank goodness they were well packaged and wrapped individually in plastic because one had leaked a little bit. The other was perfect.  Years ago it was antibacterial as most Dial body washes were, but that is no longer the case. Again, for those of you in the back, it does not contain any antibacterial ingredients stop freaking asking. It's now a basic body wash plain and simple. It does no miraculous things to your skin. If you aren't an occasional lotion user, it will probably dry your skin, as all body washes will eventually.  Use lotion you lazy animal. The smell is not a strong herbal scent and does not stick with you all day long. If you want to smell like you rolled in the lavender then sprinted through the jasmine during a twilight moon for the next 2 weeks, be prepared to be disappointed. It is a light fresh pleasant floral scent. I love the scent at 37 years old and so does my 3 girls ages 4, 11, 19. My husband who is very scent sensitive, prefers me to use this body wash as it does not make him sneeze or whine like a baby about his precious sensitivities. According to one reviewer you have to be a 12 year old to like it. Guess I'm young at heart. It cost less than your monthly streaming service, just try one single bottle before purchasing a whole case. If you don't like it, don't buy it again. See how easy that was. Now go forth and wash yo booty.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020
column14: I bought this based on reviews from others hyping it up on here but I regret it. It smells like something a12 year old girl would love, like that cheap perfume you buy from a drug store. Granted, it's not as bad as regular dial hand soap, it doesn't give me the moisturizing effect I expect from a body wash.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020
column14: Working at a funeral home, I'm always looking for a good quality, large quantity, and disinfecting body wash for the individuals we serve. (Probably not something people think about.). Being a woman in the funeral industry, I try and pick a fragrance that is pleasant, but a body wash that is also effective at cleansing and disinfecting. We try to ensure that all individuals we serve are care for with dignity and respect, and one of those last things you can do for someone is to make sure they have a proper bath. This dial body wash is perfect for ensuring that loved ones are taken care of properly, given that proper bath, and also has excellent disinfecting properties. The scent is both pleasant for men and women, and gits rid of any dirt and debris, especially underneath fingernails. I love that it comes in a huge jumbo bottle, so it allows me to use plenty for each individual, and really allows me to do my job efficiently. I'll continue buying this product for our funeral home and would recommend it to anyone.

I have bought this specific size/brand before at grocery/pharmacy stores and thought those spilled out quickly as well. So I didn't really notice a difference. I think the quick spilling at first has more to do with the weight and amount of liquid in the container, rather than it being diluted. As I continued to use the body was and the amount lessened the liquid spills out much slower. The ones that I bought (shipped and sold from Amazon) works just like any other body wash. I also love getting it shipped to my house so I don't have to make a trip to the grocery store just for body wash. I will buy this again when I run out, and may even try different scents/formulas.

column6: Great product, but check expiration dates

Weirdly, it has only been at certain times of my life - not consistently.  Nonetheless, I have had patches of eczema on my hands for about 5 years and I can't find a product that makes it better, including prescribed creams.  I like the idea of a ph balanced soap so that I don't keep stripping my skin dry, so I decided to try this product.  It smells great, gives you a clean feeling and a little goes a long way.  However, it didn't necessarily help my eczema.  I think if I made sure to moisturize ALL the time, that would help but honestly, I don't think to do it after I wash my hands.  It's like cutting up vegetables for a salad or something, it just feels like a lot of work.  (Yes, I am acutely aware that I would have died on the first day as a pioneer, "Skin this rabbit for dinner?  Uhhh, no thank you.")  But I digress, the point is that I really do like the soap and I like supporting organic/non-GMO/fair trade/natural products and their companies so I gave it 4 stars; 5 if it had cleared up my skin.  Of note, perhaps if the eczema was on a part of my body that isn't washed 13 times per day, I might have had a better outcome.

The first ingredient is NEEM which for avid planthusiasts, is a necessity for fighting off pests that arise. The fact is also, neem oil is best used when you mix it with some sort of soap to help it bind together to spray on your leaves. I was desperate one day to clean my dusty leaves and figured that this organic formula is actually PERFECT as long as you dilute the soap with lots of water. I used one tiny pump with lots water and mixed it in a spray bottle onto a microfiber cloth. This concoction worked BEAUTIFULLY for getting the job done and I haven‚Äôt gotten any pests since then. My leaves are so shiny and beautiful and since taking off that layer of dust on them, they have been growing faster as there‚Äôs nothing impeding them from  receiving ample light. I do believe the original version is best for this HACK since we don‚Äôt know how the essential oils on the other options are going to react to your plants. As far as a body cleanser, it is nice however I still prefer something with SLS from time to time to get rid of grime and a little funk from the underarms. column13: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
column14: I'm not a "mama to be" but I am a mama of an infant. Although I am not currently pregnant, I still try to stick to the items I was using when pregnant, avoiding certain chemicals and harsher ingredients. My period is back and every once in a while I get hormonal breakouts. I'm glad I found this because this is exactly what I was looking for! I've actually never tried Honest skincare products aside from their baby products like diapers so I was intrigued. I am only using this as a face wash because I have no breakouts on my body. I found it easy to spread and lather on my face because of its gel like consistency, and it was easily rinsed off. It didn't dry out my face and I didn't experience any irritation after use. It is too soon to tell if it will help with my hormonal breakouts but my skin usually clears itself up after a few days anyway - but I just like that there are ingredients in this that will help me "glow". While I personally would have liked for this one to have a light fragrance, I understand fragrance free is probably very important for any pregnant moms, so I can't complain. I didn't like the fragrance free smell of this product (that no scent, scent - if that makes any sense!) but it is bearable. This is quite a large tube and since I am using it only as a face wash and not body wash, it will last me quite a while. I recommend any pregnant mamas to look into this cleanser if you want a gentle glow.

column14: While I am not currently pregnant, my skin has been out of control since I gave birth to my daughter and I am always having breakouts so I figured this might be a good option for my skin. For my face I just took a small amount in my hands and rubbed it all over for a minute and then rinsed. So far I haven't noticed any drastic changes to my breakouts, but they definitely aren't any worse and I think with time I will hopefully notice some improvements. I really like that this is a product designed specifically for pregnant women because when I was pregnant, I felt as though every product was off limits to me, or had a warning about checking with your doctor before using. I am sure pregnant women appreciate having something made with their skin specifically in mind. The only thing that I dislike is the scent.
