column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2022
column13: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
column14: I am a fan of PiperWai's natural deodorant, so I am really pleased to see that they are branching out into other products like these body washes. While they aren't 100% completely organic and/or natural ingredients, PiperWai does try to use as high a quantity of natural ingredients as they can. For anyone with sensitive skin or trouble with skincare products loaded with additives and preservatives, this brand is a good choice. The unscented body wash is preferable for anyone that doesn't like pefumey products or is bothered by heavy scents. It has a mild 'soapy' scent, but nothing that lingers on skin or that will make your shower seem like you are breathing in nothing but fragrance vapors. You can also add a little of your favorite essential oil scent (or even favorite eau de toilette or eau de parfum) to create a custom scented body wash. The ginger chamomile body wash has a pleasant though quite light scent of fresh ginger. It's a refreshing way to start your morning off, but the scent doesn't last once you are done bathing.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018
column14: I do not have time to mess with reapplying lipstick all day long and also don‚Äôt like leaving lipstick marks everywhere. Covergirl Outlast lipcolors have solved this problem for me! column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
column14: I wore Lip Ink for 20 years. I forgot my Lip Ink on a business trip and ran to the drugstore for a replacement. I bought Outlast and fell in love. It did wear off after 10 hours, but after playing around with it, I learned the trick: If you apply two coats, it can last over 24 hours  I put on two coats at 7AM every day. When I get home from work nearly 12 hours later, it still looks freshly applied! I replaced my dark red Cosmo Red Lip Ink and 840 Scarlet. I replaced my everyday nude Sand Wood Lip Ink with 621 Natural. I replaced old school bright red Energy Red Lip Ink with 820 Red.  It cost much less than Lip Ink and, with the convenience of Subscribe and Save, I don't even have to make a trip to the drugstore for it!

column6: Pros and cons, but mostly pros
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2019
column14: I was pleasantly surprised by these lipsticks. I've never really worn lipstick before so I wanted a sort of starter set to figure out what I like and how to use them. These lipsticks are great for that. The colors are bright and the formulas are mostly very creamy. The packaging is beautiful and compact and they actually last quite a while at least in my experience. They do transfer quite a bit but once they've completely dried down they don't transfer as much unless you really rub them. Even when they do transfer, the look of the lips is still pretty neat and bright. I usually only have to reapply once or twice in a day and even then it's not because they look bad it's just because I happened to be near a mirror and figured I would just because. In the two pictures of my face I'm wearing Orchid which is by far my favorite and it's very creamy and long lasting. There are some shades that I dont like but that all just comes down to them being too bright and my own personal preference being more neutral, brownish tones. Another downside is that they do make my lips feel pretty dry throughout the day, but I dont notice it most of the time and I think it's worth it because I feel good that I look good.

column6: from the tube it looks like there is a nice spectrum of colors ranging from ...
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2017
column14: This set of lipsticks was rather disappointing in that, from the tube it looks like there is a nice spectrum of colors ranging from soft to deep, but when applied they are all very light-- more like a tinted chapstick in terms of color saturation. The lipstick itself has a nice buttery feel when applied but there is simply not enough pigment in these lipsticks to make them look on the lips the same color as they appear in the tube. Even a straightforward classic red only registers light pink on the lips and when tested on my hand. Some barely register a color. Probably better to spend money on a single tube of lipstick you know you love rather than buy a set of 12 that are just so-so and indistinct. That said, if you like very sheer lipsticks you may like this, but just know that rather than 12 distinct shades, its more like 4-5 shades with very incremental differences between them.

I didn‚Äôt make the connection until it happened to me again for a third time (wish I would have figured it out after the second time wearing it). I had to hide the lipstick from my daughter so she‚Äôll wear mine. The colors were great and it did seem to last just as long as my other lipsticks. But I have to give it the one star due to the effect it had on our lips

The caps come off without much effort when they are in my makeup bag and the lipstick transfers to other surfaces and fabric if you are not careful. I will recommend this set to build your Lipstick collection!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2020
column14: Loved this product! It was worth every penny and I'd definitely buy one again! This was the first time I spent this much money on a lip color but I'm glad I chose this one as my first. It's easy to create the shape you want for your lips and/or to use with lip liner. One night I used it as a base under my glitter lip application and it paired well. Give it a try! column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018
column14: Ok at this point, I guess it's safe (and sad) to say that I am ADDICTED to this matte lip ink/lipstick! I LOVE IT. I put it on on the morning and if I don't take it off before I go to bed, which I always do, it will still be there in the morning. I use the Maybelline SuperStay eraser (basically chapstick) and then I follow it up with the Lanc√¥me Eye Makeup Remover to get the rest because it stays on so well (I know it says it's for eyes but it takes this waterproof lipstick off perfectly). I couldn't stop buying these colors! I'm a brown/caramel complexion and I think I bought every shade to compliment my skin tone. My favorites are 20, 25, 30, 35, and 40...I guess that sequence might be a coincidence! I wear 20 (Pioneer) and 40 (Believer) the most. The colors I received do look slightly different on the brown skinned swatch, and some colors look better on a full face (makeup). I also had Huntress (Not pictured here) but I gave it to my BFF because she does a full face and it looked amazing on her, she's maybe a half shade darker than me but she has the face for it, it just didn't go with my faux 'stache (it's really just a shadow on my upper lip, I refuse to wax or shave and make it noticeable to the world). Some of the shades I still have would go better with makeup, and maybe they would be better with liner, but it's not the kind of lipstick to use when practicing because once it's on, it's on! One of my colors came in and I think something was wrong with the one I got because it goes on gritty. But all the others are smooth and I don't have to ever reapply, I would actually advise against reapplication. Better to remove it and start over, or hurry up and take it off before it dries, about 3 minutes. I am sure I'll end of buying more, and perhaps rebuy the one that came in bad to see if it does anything for me when it can apply right lol.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2017

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2019
column14: This is just about the perfect mauve I've been searching for since my favorite was discontinued. It is def matte so if you don't like that this is not for you. It wears very well (being a matte) and I don't have to apply lipstick for hours even after drinking and light eating. It's not 'masky' like some ultra mattes, but is definitely a thicker lipstick, not a sheer. You can apply a lighter toned gloss in the center if you don't like the feel of it. If you are a brunette with dark eyes and a darker skin tone, this is a great natural looking mauve with a subtle pop of color. Love it.

Each container of lip gloss is shaped like a tall rectangular pillar, clear at the bottom with a solid black screw off top. It's all plastic, but the clear part looks like frosted glass, and looks very expensive. The Omaniac logo is in shiny green on the top of the black cap. The overall effect is of a very high end, elegant item. Each lip gloss goes on wet and shiny and keeps much of its bright color as it dries. This set of five containers of lip gloss is a good value at the current listing price of $24.99, and my wife and I both consider it very giftable.

column6: Go on smooth, not a gloss

column14: These are definitely a matte liquid lipstick and not a lip gloss. Sellers need to stop saying that because matte is literally the opposite of glossy  -- they can't be both. They come with a nice applicator and the color goes on smooth -- it's easy to get a solid color and it doesn't look splotchy. I was hoping some of the colors would have more pink in them but all of these colors are very warm and have an orange base to them so be aware of that. column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2021
column14: This is definitely one of the better liquid lipsticks I have tried by far.  I've been trying out so many of them since wearing a mask.  Most of them are awful-very drying and/or cakey, wear off too soon, all sort of problems.  This one is very nice.  I don't find it too drying, I won't go as far as to say that is not drying at all, it is slightly so, but not bad.  It wears very, very well, and I don't get a lot of caking on the inner lip with it.  It wears a long time, and I get very little to none wearing off on my mask.  I bought 006, Eyes on You, which is a nice medium neutral brown-but-not-too-brown, it has enough of a pink or some undertone to it to keep it from being brown.  And I have 009, Speak Up, which is a medium neutral pinky mauve, not Barbie or bubblegum pink by any means, just a neutral pink leaning warmer.  Both are very easy to wear shades that could be called Neutral shades to wear easily with most things.  I am sold on this formula, they did well with this.

column6: Wear a foundation or a cream before you apply it!

I 'bleeds' and the color becomes like an orange/redish type of distasteful stuff. HOWEVER, if you use a cream or a foundation, everything changes and you'll have a beautiful lipstick that glides easily on your lips and give you the enhanced  velvet color you want. column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021
column14: This is a very nice matte lipstick. Beautifully opaque, richly pigmented, it glides on like a satin formula but it dries down to a lovely velvet finish. The color More Scarlet is a gorgeous warm toned true red. Like any bullet style lipstick it does have some transfer, but the transfer is minimal. It also doesn‚Äôt feather or bleed. The slim style helps with the precision of the application. But I would still recommend using a lip liner for a more precise outline if you overline your lips. It wears comfortably, I didn‚Äôt notice any drying sensation on the lips. I wish that the shade range was bigger, but hopefully that will come in time. All in all, this lipstick works just as well as several of my high end lipsticks (Pat McGrath, Fenty). And looks indistinguishable from the high end formulas.

I waited and waited for this to dry down and it never did. At least 10 to 15 minutes. I sat there with my mouth gaping open and every time I touched my lips together little pieces would start to gather together on my lips. Once I grabbed my translucent powder and dabbed it on my lips with my fingers the problem was gone and I now have a beautiful, dry pucker. Here's to hoping you guys read this!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2021
column14: Have worn this color forever, get a lot of compliments on it.  A week or so ago, I had surgery which required their putting a tube down my throat and trying to open up my stomach opening.  After the surgery, I was in the recovery room and took off my mask to put my clothes back on and my friend who'd brought me for the procedure noticed that my lipstick was still on after I'd gotten there with a mask on, gone through surgery which required a tube being put down my throat, then putting my mask back on, wearing the mask again for a while and then, when taking the mask off to put my clothing back on, my lipstick was still going strong.  I thought nothing of it because I've been wearing it since 1990.  My friend pointed out that most lipsticks don't stay on through all that.  Impressive!  And for the price, you can't beat it!  I get so many compliments on the color, 425 Vintage Wine, but I also wear, 420 a mauve color and 770 a bronze color.  All Cover Girl Continuous Color.  It lives up to its name!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018
column14: I do not have time to mess with reapplying lipstick all day long and also don‚Äôt like leaving lipstick marks everywhere. Covergirl Outlast lipcolors have solved this problem for me! column14: I wore Lip Ink for 20 years. I forgot my Lip Ink on a business trip and ran to the drugstore for a replacement. I bought Outlast and fell in love. It did wear off after 10 hours, but after playing around with it, I learned the trick: If you apply two coats, it can last over 24 hours  I put on two coats at 7AM every day. When I get home from work nearly 12 hours later, it still looks freshly applied! I replaced my dark red Cosmo Red Lip Ink and 840 Scarlet. I replaced my everyday nude Sand Wood Lip Ink with 621 Natural. I replaced old school bright red Energy Red Lip Ink with 820 Red.  It cost much less than Lip Ink and, with the convenience of Subscribe and Save, I don't even have to make a trip to the drugstore for it!

column6: I had to venture away from the liquid formula lipsticks for summer and this is a perfect choice!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2018
column14: I am and always have been a liquid lipstick kind if girl but the other day I realized I was going to have to venture out and experiment with done lighter formulas because my summer eyeshadow palettes bought so far are more matched with a lipstick not as bold and deep looking as a liquid matte.  First I bought a few from Loreal Riche color shine line and I fell in love so I wanted something along the lines of that without the hi shine finish so i can switch it up a bit throughout summer.  This lipstick is my answer.  I love the formula...feels soft and comfortable...not dry.  I ordered 2 colors to start and this is the 1st I received.  The pictures are definitely deceiving add to the color.  And being fair skinned, Iv have to be careful because it doesn't take much for a shade to look to dark out bright on me. When I opened this, I was convinced it was going to be way to dark but when I applied it, I was pleased to see that it's not as opaque as I thought and i was able to sheet it or across my lips and the end result was very flattering.  With a pop of gloss in the center...I was left wondering why it had taken me so long to discover such a pretty, comfortable lipstick.  People complain about having to reapply but you should know before you purchase a creamy lipsticklike this that it is an inevitable part of wearing t his kind if formula.  I don't mind doing it...it takes 2 seconds and my lips always look freshly applied.  Well be buying more shades

column6: A great lipstick and a great color!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2015
column14: I saw this product used on Emma Stone at the Oscars and thought she looked wonderful. This is more of a coral while still having an orange tint--it is exactly what I was looking for color-wise.  I especially love the texture and low-shine of this lipstick.  There is still a little shine, but I'd call it more of a satin.  Less shine looks better on women my age (early 50's).  I would suggest going to Revlon's site to review the colors if you don't know what color to purchase, or check it out at a store if you have any questions about color.  I'm very happy with the quality and color of this lipstick.  As far as the cost--I probably could have found this much cheaper in a local store, but I'm disabled and have a hard time getting out, so I was willing to pay a bit more for the convenience of delivery.  I do think this lipstick is as high in quality as some designer/department store brands.  Well done, Revlon.

But as soon as I put my finger in the first shadow to swatch them, I could immediately tell they weren‚Äôt real high-end eyeshadows. I swatched all the shades and they were a bit powdery but most still had decent pigment so I decided to give it a shot on the eyes. I‚Äôve used it twice now and as soon as I started blending the first shadow on my lid, I could tell it was fake. The shadows are powdery, don‚Äôt blend well and there‚Äôs a TON of fallout. These are hands down NOT high end eyeshadows. I tapped my brush into the shadows lightly just one time and it was like a dust storm of eyeshadow everywhere. Is it usable? Yes. But nowhere near worth $40 or even the $22 that I paid when it was on sale. Spend your money elsewhere!

The CoverGirl logo is in the right font, and the strip is black, not silver, like every other CG product ever. C) the product itself was clearer than the one i used to own, meaning theres less lotion, and more petroleum jelly.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
column14: First off, I love this product.  The color goes on beautifully, does not feather, is not sticky, and lasts almost all day.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2019
column14: I have been using Covergirl Outlast lip color for years, because it does what it says. I have never had any of it come off on anything  from napkins to kissed babies to my hand.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018
column14: I do not have time to mess with reapplying lipstick all day long and also don‚Äôt like leaving lipstick marks everywhere. Covergirl Outlast lipcolors have solved this problem for me! Lipcolor evens out my lip color and lasts for a good 8-10 hrs only fading slightly (yet evenly) as the day wears on. The colors are good neutral shades, as well... I have at least 5 shades that are good on me depending on the look I want. I usually line outside with a slightly darker color for defined look and then immediately swipe a coordinating paler color on central lip, blending with my finger before it sets. This seems to give my lip color a more natural look. Love this lipcolor!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2017
column14: This lipstick is amazing. I've tried several all day lipsticks recently (Maybeline Superstay 24 Hour, Revlon Colorstay Overtime, Jeffree Star) and none of them compare to this one. It goes on smooth, dries quickly and evenly, and lasts through pretty much anything including eating and drinking. I love the lip balm that goes over top. It's moisturizing without being too glossy and is great for refreshing the color. Still looks good as new after 8 hours! See my photo for a glimpse of Canyon. This lipstick is my new favorite!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2017
column14: This stuff is seriously amazing. It stands up to even the higher end brands like Stila and Lipsense! You can't beat the price and the colors are beautiful. It lasted through all my meals. I can't believe such an awesome product is made by Covergirl!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
column14: I wore Lip Ink for 20 years. I forgot my Lip Ink on a business trip and ran to the drugstore for a replacement. I bought Outlast and fell in love. It lasts as long as Lip Ink, but looks like a matte lipstick. It did wear off after 10 hours, but after playing around with it, I learned the trick: If you apply two coats, it can last over 24 hours  I put on two coats at 7AM every day. When I get home from work nearly 12 hours later, it still looks freshly applied! I replaced my dark red Cosmo Red Lip Ink and 840 Scarlet. I replaced my everyday nude Sand Wood Lip Ink with 621 Natural. I replaced old school bright red Energy Red Lip Ink with 820 Red.  It cost much less than Lip Ink and, with the convenience of Subscribe and Save, I don't even have to make a trip to the drugstore for it!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2017

column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2017
column14: Honestly, I wasn't sure what to expect from these, but for the price, I figured it was worth a shot. After trying them out, however, I am really impressed.  I've used a few of NYX's Lingerie matte liquid lipsticks (which these obviously aim to mimic by the packaging) and they work just as well, if not better than the NYX versions, which are $7-8 each.  Depending on the specific shade, some of these actually have more pigment and go on easier than the NYX colors that I have.  Some colors can feel a little sticky at first, but it's just a matter of giving them time to dry.  I swatched them all on my forearm and had to really scrub to get them off, so they definitely require more than just water to remove.  I haven't yet tried out the full 15 for daily wear, but those I have tested out have held up really well...I'm talking coffee, tacos, pasta, pizza, even a day-long Memorial Day barbecue, without ever really feeling the need to reapply.  The darker browns or reds may need a little more of a touch up than the others.  Some of the colors aren't necessarily what I'd go for; a little bolder than I'd like, but it's an excellent price if you want to give some new shades a try without much commitment. Would definitely purchase again.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019
column14: I've tried several long lasting lipsticks over the past few weeks. All were liquids.  I could not find the right color for one thing.  The other is they looked painted on, not natural.  Been wearing Revlon Super Lustrous Blushing Mauve.  This is very close in color but just a slight more pink than my natural lip color, but usable.  So I ordered the Iconic color and that color comes close to matching my lips.  I reordered Socialite and Wardrobe.  Wardrobe is a bit more purplish than the picture.  It is a strong color like maybe a burnt red.  Socialite on the other hand is almost an exact match to my lip color.  Perfect for me, no more looking.  May try a few more colors if they go on sale for special occasions.  But for everyday use Socialite is for me, basically not noticable yet gives me even color over my whole lips and keeps my lips from the occasional peeling.  I took a drink after 10 minutes and had very little transfer and after 15 minutes had no transfer.  After about 40 minutes I ate a Pork Chop off the bone and did seem to lose a bit but color was still there, just worn down a bit.  I put it on at around 11 am and it was still there at 9 pm.  I have also used Preview on my upper lip and Iconic on the bottom lip then rubbed them together and end up with a color in between the two.  These people saying that it doesn't last must be constantly licking their lips or putting a lip balm on top of it.

I'm going to try wearing it with a lip primer underneath, and see how that goes.  I often find that helps with some of the dryer lipsticks in making them more comfortable.  But I like this enough to try other colors.

column14: This is pretty damn good. I have yet to find a product that stays on like this. This is nuts. I wore it for the first time today and took pictures throughout my day of my lips and how the color stayed. It stays pink basically the entire day. I did not reapply anything at any point, not even the gloss layer. I taught students, ate lunch, drank from a can, took my dog to the vet, licked my lips 900 times, and still have it on currently as I type this. We are going on about 8 hours. It has no sign of going away anytime soon, either. You can tell from the pictures that after a few hours the color start to fade from the inner lip, but it stays on enough in this particular shade that it still gives the impression of being fully on. I think if I had reapplied just once as a little touch up it would‚Äôve been super perfect. So that‚Äôs what my one star deduction is for (if they had half stars I‚Äôd only have taken a half for that)... a tiny part of the deduction too is the size. This tube is so small. But I guess since you really don‚Äôt need more than 1 touch up the entire day or day, (and it‚Äôs not $ at all) you won‚Äôt really be using it all the much. Plus, I think I can touch up once over 8 hours and still consider it ‚Äúall day wear‚Äù.  This stuff is amazing. I‚Äôd like other shades but I‚Äôm afraid they won‚Äôt last as good. But everyone‚Äôs reviews seem to be pretty across the board.  I mean look at my pics... that sh^t barely budged all day.

column14: I'm super picky about my lipsticks. Since they're so close to my nose (duh ;) ), I find myself avoiding any that smell perfumey, waxy, or even (so oddly) kind of rancid. The color of this lipstick is absolutely stunning - a neutral mauve / rose / brown - and the texture is nice and creamy. Time will tell if I end up loving it or not, but already I'm finding the scent off-putting and gravitating toward other lipsticks with less offensive smells. It's possible that this one just sat around in a warehouse too long, but whatever it is, it's not a smell I want to experience for very long or very often. Given that I wanted this to be my new everyday go-to lipstick, that's really disappointing and for that I give it only 4 stars. column14: The quality of this lipstick is great; definitely one of the better drugstore formulations I have tried. I compared it to Mac Ruby Woo and Armani 400 (I use both luxury and drugstore lip colors) and this is a warm, almost even kind of rusty red. It's nicely pigmented, but I wouldn't call it "bright" either. I'm not sure that this really does anything for my warm olive skintone. I also got 107, and I like that one much better (it's darker and has a better scent). The scent on 001 is fruity, but quite mild. column6: A good black lipstick is hard to find...

It isn‚Äôt too much one color or the other. It is definitely more berry/plum than brown-toned, for certain. It‚Äôs both super creamy and intensely pigmented. Zero noticeable smell. I‚Äôm still on the hunt for a perfect MLBB that I can wear extremely casually, like for no makeup around the house etc. (I‚Äôm going to try ‚ÄúBlushing Mauve‚Äù which is a pearlized color.) column6: Third row image is the most representative
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
column14: I was expecting a neutral matte lipstick.  It's actually darker with a shimmer (take note of the 3rd row of pics featured by the seller) and I absolutely LOVE IT!  So much better than the first couple pics and is my new fave over Katy Perry's Catoure which I also love but Catoure needs several back and forth strokes for good pigmentation, frequent reapplications and while its also a great product, this Coffee Crave just needs a swipe top and bottom and bam, you're done for a good long while.  It looks spectacular.  The sparkly shimmer was an unexpected bonus and very flattering on me.  As I'm nearing 50, I'm starting to note difficulties with product gathering into lip lines.  This product does just a little bit but overall stays in place (including no transfer to my teeth!) which is noteworthy since it's a very moisturizing product and I would have expected it to bleed significantly.  With many lipsticks costing $8 and $9 or even more in stores, this one at $5.79 is fairly priced and I see many other colors even cheaper in the $3 and $4 range.  Assuming they all have similar properties as this Coffee Crave in pigmentation, moisturization and length of wear, this is a bargain product.

column14: These lipsticks are absolutely amazing!! I love them. The packaging is cute with the sea theme. The lipstick tubes themselves are SO pretty, I've already shown these off a few times (to friends and strangers!). These are very long lasting, and the lipstick formula acts almost like a lip stain but not as strong as that. The blue lasted me a good 8 hours. Not kidding. The color is very vibrant and attractive. You do need to let the lipstick dry completely before concealing the edges of your lips or feathering may happen (it did for me). When I applied the lipstick and then made sure it was dry, there was no feathering at all. Nada. The feel was very light on my lips; the color was fully saturated yet it didn't feel heavy or overbearing. I totally recommend this product, not only because of the excellent performance and vibrant colors, also because the tubes are adorable and so fun to show off. Great product and would make a lovely gift!

column14: I did A LOT of research before buying this product.  I enjoy makeup but am not someone who spends a lot on it. column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2017
column14: My absolute favorite lip color.  I've used a few different shades and have been pleased with all of them. It stays on for a very long time and doesn't leave my lips feeling like they've been coated in gunk. It does dry your lips out a bit, but thats normal with long-wear lip products and is easily fixed with some chapstick after removing it in the evening. Time will tell if I end up loving it or not, but already I'm finding the scent off-putting and gravitating toward other lipsticks with less offensive smells. It's possible that this one just sat around in a warehouse too long, but whatever it is, it's not a smell I want to experience for very long or very often. Given that I wanted this to be my new everyday go-to lipstick, that's really disappointing and for that I give it only 4 stars. It's nicely pigmented, but I wouldn't call it "bright" either. I'm not sure that this really does anything for my warm olive skintone. I also got 107, and I like that one much better (it's darker and has a better scent). The scent on 001 is fruity, but quite mild. column6: By far my favorite red lipstick!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2020
column14: I have dozens of red lipsticks.  Why you ask?  Because not all red lipsticks are equal.  Some make your teeth look yellow like a toxic substance, others are unflattering to your skin tone and then a lot of them are drying or bleed or smear all over your face.  I know I can put this lipstick on in the morning (even though I'm not going anywhere I still wear it - strictly for me) and it will still look good before I take it off at night.  So it lasts through lunch, dinner, a snack or 2 and several coffees, pops, waters and tea.  If I eat something that has some oil in it the inner part of my lips might need a touch up but normally I don't touch it all day.  It makes me look better with it than I look without it.  Even my adult son who mostly hates the look of lipsticks on anyone has complimented me on this lipstick.  I think his exact words were - 'nice lipstick'!  That's as good a compliment as I've ever gotten.  I will keep this one in stock.

column6: Third row image is the most representative
column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
column14: I was expecting a neutral matte lipstick.  It's actually darker with a shimmer (take note of the 3rd row of pics featured by the seller) and I absolutely LOVE IT!  So much better than the first couple pics and is my new fave over Katy Perry's Catoure which I also love but Catoure needs several back and forth strokes for good pigmentation, frequent reapplications and while its also a great product, this Coffee Crave just needs a swipe top and bottom and bam, you're done for a good long while.  It looks spectacular.  The sparkly shimmer was an unexpected bonus and very flattering on me.  As I'm nearing 50, I'm starting to note difficulties with product gathering into lip lines.  This product does just a little bit but overall stays in place (including no transfer to my teeth!) which is noteworthy since it's a very moisturizing product and I would have expected it to bleed significantly.  With many lipsticks costing $8 and $9 or even more in stores, this one at $5.79 is fairly priced and I see many other colors even cheaper in the $3 and $4 range.  Assuming they all have similar properties as this Coffee Crave in pigmentation, moisturization and length of wear, this is a bargain product.

column6: Underrated bullet lipstick. Hands down probably the best drugstore matte that rivals high end.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2021
column14: What a beautiful brown! My favorite shades are hot chocolate (pictured) and Shameless. Both beautiful for muted-warm olive skin tones. Like all bullet lipsticks, this is not super long lasting and you'll have to reapply, but for a bullet lipstick the longevity is good. I've tried just about all drugstore bullet lipsticks. Hands down this is the best one, especially for a matte. The Maybelline ones are a nice formula with a wide shade range but I can't stand the waxy cosmetic smell and taste. The Milani Color Statement has beautiful brown-red shades and the formula is long lasting but can tug on the lips if they're not well prepped. NYX Suede Matte is a very nice formula as well just not as creamy and easy to glide as this one and can also be a little tuggy if you have very dry patches. The L'Or√©al ones I just can't stand the floral smell, which is disappointing because their shades are beautiful. The Milani Color Fetish Mattes are probably a close second favorite to this Revlon one but they only have 5 nude shades -  wish they made more. I just wish Revlon made more rosey-brown reds (like NYX exotic), muted terracota browns, and more muted brick red shades. Please make more shades! If they expand their shade range I think most of my bullet lipsticks would be from this line. Y'all are sleeping on Revlon bullet lipsticks! I choose these over my MAC or other more expensive lipsticks any day, especially for the price. I've heard people say these are dupes formula-wise for the Lisa Eldridge velvet matte lipsticks but I don't have one to compare. The only thing I will say is Revlon needs to work on making the pictures more true to color as they're way off. Probably would help to have arm swatches.

column14: I do not have time to mess with reapplying lipstick all day long and also don‚Äôt like leaving lipstick marks everywhere. Covergirl Outlast lipcolors have solved this problem for me! Lipcolor evens out my lip color and lasts for a good 8-10 hrs only fading slightly (yet evenly) as the day wears on. The colors are good neutral shades, as well... I have at least 5 shades that are good on me depending on the look I want. I usually line outside with a slightly darker color for defined look and then immediately swipe a coordinating paler color on central lip, blending with my finger before it sets. This seems to give my lip color a more natural look. Love this lipcolor!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
column14: I wore Lip Ink for 20 years. I forgot my Lip Ink on a business trip and ran to the drugstore for a replacement. I bought Outlast and fell in love. It lasts as long as Lip Ink, but looks like a matte lipstick. It did wear off after 10 hours, but after playing around with it, I learned the trick: If you apply two coats, it can last over 24 hours  I put on two coats at 7AM every day. When I get home from work nearly 12 hours later, it still looks freshly applied! I replaced my dark red Cosmo Red Lip Ink and 840 Scarlet. I replaced my everyday nude Sand Wood Lip Ink with 621 Natural. I replaced old school bright red Energy Red Lip Ink with 820 Red.  It cost much less than Lip Ink and, with the convenience of Subscribe and Save, I don't even have to make a trip to the drugstore for it!

column6: Meh ... Not much good about it.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020
column14: My ol Loreal fave from my teen years (circa 89-90) was a lovely frosty shade of plum/mauve. I believe it was called Plumrose or maybe even Primrose. Anyhoo ‚Ä¶ since they quit making it I've moved on. Switched to all natural, cruelty free, professional brand. But when I saw "Primrose" here on Amazon I couldn't resist seeing if it was indeed my old favorite from back in the day. Kind of thought based on the color swatch pictures I'd gotten lucky as it looked to be a very close match. Not so much. It's very pink, not at all frosty, and not even close to the swatch. I tried again with Soft Mauve thinking it might be less "pink" and more rose/plum/mauve and maybe "the one". Nope. It's almost the exact same shade as the Primrose. Both are too bright/pink and lean more to what I'd call fuchsia than plum or rose or even mauve. They both arrived just tossed in a box, no packaging, no seal, nothing. They appeared to be new/unused despite not seal. Going on they feel smooth and you can tell they have oils in them. I got about ten seconds of wear out of it before it disappeared. I wasn't expecting long-wearing but ten seconds? You'd literally have to carry these around in your hand all day and keep reapplying them constantly if you ended up liking the color (which I didn't). So, back to my new favorite brand I go and will give up the search for my long-lost favorite from way back when. Oh well.

The color is very similar to the discontinued shade,  but doesn't last at all after eating or drinking.  I really wanted a matte finish that would stay on longer.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018
column14: I do not have time to mess with reapplying lipstick all day long and also don‚Äôt like leaving lipstick marks everywhere. Covergirl Outlast lipcolors have solved this problem for me! I have at least 5 shades that are good on me depending on the look I want. I usually line outside with a slightly darker color for defined look and then immediately swipe a coordinating paler color on central lip, blending with my finger before it sets. This seems to give my lip color a more natural look. Love this lipcolor!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
column14: I wore Lip Ink for 20 years. I forgot my Lip Ink on a business trip and ran to the drugstore for a replacement. I bought Outlast and fell in love. It lasts as long as Lip Ink, but looks like a matte lipstick. It did wear off after 10 hours, but after playing around with it, I learned the trick: If you apply two coats, it can last over 24 hours  I put on two coats at 7AM every day. When I get home from work nearly 12 hours later, it still looks freshly applied! I replaced my dark red Cosmo Red Lip Ink and 840 Scarlet. I replaced my everyday nude Sand Wood Lip Ink with 621 Natural. I replaced old school bright red Energy Red Lip Ink with 820 Red.  It cost much less than Lip Ink and, with the convenience of Subscribe and Save, I don't even have to make a trip to the drugstore for it!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2015
column14: I gotta say, I absolutely love these Maybelline Color Sensational lipsticks! They feel amazing on my lips.  Glides on smoothly, can be built up easily by adding more and more layers, smells like sweet vanilla, and lasts hours longer on my lips than a typical balm or creamy lip product. My favorite part about these: the super inexpensive price! I've tried some "luxury" lipsticks here lately and honestly there's no reason for me to spend more than $10 on a decent lipstick when these Sensational lippies and colors are out on the market. A lot of expensive brands are too drying or are nice and creamy but don't last long, which kinda defeats the purpose of spending a lot of dough on something. Maybelline's got the best of both worlds.  I have this in Brazen Berry (goes on a beautiful fuchsia pink but can be built up to a bright purple) and Electric Orange (which is definitely electric!).  These lipsticks are great and for the price you should pick up a few different colors!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2015

This color is on point! It's just a hint of pinky-purple, it goes so nicely with my skin tone. I wore it today and got tons of compliments on it and my lips feel so moist even in this cold New York weather. I LOVE it!!!! I'm thinking of getting a different color in my next order.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2019
column14: As a woman of color, don't you dislike shopping online and only seeing reviews regarding European women? No shade, but some products do not look great on our skin. Case in point: Beauty Glazed Matte Liquid Lipstick. I put all six colors on my outer arm (where we tend to be more melaninated from the sun) to see how they look with my undertones. The first two are a hard pass but I can use them in conjunction with other shades to create custom colors. The second two were  better and maybe can be used when I wear my lips two-toned (upper lip different color from bottom). The last two were slam dunks! Right on the money with my mahogany skin. These are good enough to stand alone. Now for the product performance; there is a marked difference between how to product felt on my arm vs lips. The reason for that is we tend to moisturize our lips with oil before applying the lip color. I use organic unrefined coconut oil. While oil made it glide on smoothly, it also made the product sticky. I noticed the arm samples dried completely and refused to budge. There was no oil on my arm. The color stuck so well to my arm I had to forcefully scrub with a makeup remover cloth to get all of it off. However, my lip color smudged and became tacky. The difference is the application of oil. Do not put oil on before the color and it will stay put without being sticky. The colors smell like chocolate though there is no flavor. Overall, the product is good.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
column14: I wore Lip Ink for 20 years. I forgot my Lip Ink on a business trip and ran to the drugstore for a replacement. I bought Outlast and fell in love. It lasts as long as Lip Ink, but looks like a matte lipstick. It did wear off after 10 hours, but after playing around with it, I learned the trick: If you apply two coats, it can last over 24 hours  I put on two coats at 7AM every day. When I get home from work nearly 12 hours later, it still looks freshly applied! I replaced my dark red Cosmo Red Lip Ink and 840 Scarlet. I replaced my everyday nude Sand Wood Lip Ink with 621 Natural. I replaced old school bright red Energy Red Lip Ink with 820 Red.  It cost much less than Lip Ink and, with the convenience of Subscribe and Save, I don't even have to make a trip to the drugstore for it!

column14: I really love this lipstick.  I happened upon a Lipstick Queen Mini Duo a few years ago and this color (St. Mauve) was one of the two. It is pricey when you can purchase a drug-store lipstick for so much less, but I have a boatload of drug-store lipsticks that I never use because the color just isn't right.  This is one I use so it's worth it.  It provides me with a nice, natural look, not too "made-up" or "overly done".  Just a slip of color.  It does not dry my lips out like other lipsticks do.  No flaking at all and no bleeding outside the lip line even though I never use a lip liner.  On me, the color comes out a bit lighter on my lips than it appears to look in the tube, which is just fine.  This one is a winner!

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022
column14: It was awkward the first time I used this. It was gross and uneven and dried pretty weirdly. The trick is to smile slightly to make the surface of your lips a bit taut. Wipe off any excess lip product from the lip applicator. There's just way too much on there right out of the tube. Now smooth the lip cream on your lips as evenly as possible preferably in one to two swipes. If you keep going back and forth too many times, it gets all bunchy and gross bc it starts to dry if you take too long. Let dry for a minute in that smile position.  Then apply the gloss over top. Just my two cents. It seemed to work great with this method. Goodluck!

If I'm applying late in the day, (to go out for instance) I will wake up in the morning with the lipstick still on a bit. The one thing I do NOT like about this lipstick is that it has a tendency to dry up and actually crack sometimes. Not always. So when that happens, another application is needed. This item is spendy in the drug stores (Walgreen's, RiteAid, CVS), but it does go on sale in the stores for a Buy One, Get One 50% off... which  I HATE those sales. Sometimes you can get lucky and the store will only have 1 in stock; they'll give you the 25% off without having to buy 2 items. When I say "they" I mean EVERYONE who makes lipsticks including M.A.C, NYX and more expensive brands. NYX gets it close, it looks correct but when you put it on the pigment changes somehow.  I'm a lipstick junkie and I've only had 2 tubes of this color lipstick that were correct, one was made by Maybelline back in the early-mid 90s and another was a tube I bought on a whim at an exclusive clothing boutique.  It was some unknown brand but it was the best pastel pink lipstick EVER!  I treasured that lipstick for a long time until it finally ran out.  And Maybelline changed their formula to the waxy, not enough pigment junk they have now.  The only thing I can find anymore that looks so so is NYX Baby Pink which is kind of purple but it works for me.  I have a very weird skin tone that only looks good with pale pinks and coral/pinks even though I am well on the north end of middle age now.  Red looks creepy on me and "nude" and darker brownish/gold colors make me look like I've been eating raw meat without wiping my mouth.  Ugh

column9: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2021
column13: Vine Customer Review of Free Product
column14: I like the way matte lipstick looks but I've never been a big fan of wearing matte lipstick. I had hoped this selection would change my mind. Not really. The lipstick goes on easily and can be custom blended with all the shades in the box--and it is a nice selection of colors--so that's good. For me though, the problem with these and other matte lipsticks is that while it goes on smoothly and looks nice, it feels tacky on my lips and has this drying effect that makes me keep licking my lips. I just can't seem to get over that and usually end up putting a gloss or chapstick on over top of the matte lipstick. These lipsticks do stay on well and have a nice matte finish, but... As far as wearing them all day, I end up as I said, putting on chapstick over the top to control the very slight tackiness and the slightly drying effect of the lipstick. Folks that like matte lipstick and don't have those same issues (it may just be that I don't wear matte lipstick enough to get used to the feel) will love this selection as the lipsticks are easy to put on and come in a lot of nice colors.
